definition: to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
blind/groundlessly/foolishly/to no purpose
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: JiaBu saying that he himself is to serve the hierarch commands, let let ying ying dont talk nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 賈布說自己是奉了教主的命令，讓任盈盈不要瞎說。

sentences.english: After we broke up, he would call me and talk rubbish .
sentences.chinese: 我們分手後，他會打電話給我，瞎說。

sentences.english: His story is total rubbish; I don't believe any of it.
sentences.chinese: 他的故事都是瞎說，我一點兒都不信。

sentences.english: It seemed to me that Sir Robert's arguments were nonsensical.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，羅伯特爵士的爭辯純屬瞎說。

sentences.english: He gave me some cock-and-bull story about having to be at his cousin's engagement party.
sentences.chinese: 他對我瞎說他一定得去參加他表弟的訂婚宴會。

definition: to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
blockhead/idiot/dunce/moron/fool
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
what?/how?/how about?/whatever/also pr. [zen3 me5 zhe5]
damn thing/(not one's) goddamn business
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
personal attack
to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
(coll.) to go crazy/to lose it/demented/unhinged
bastard/scoundrel/rogue
